main event: A civilian observed a red balloon that flashed three times over Puyallup, Washington on July 16, 1956.
interesting points: The balloon was red on one side and moved at high speed without sound or power.,The sighting duration was about 30 seconds.,The object caused in sight after an unknown interval time.,It was identified as a weather balloon released in the area.,The report concluded that it could also be a meteorite or aircraft.
